sen.j: 日野 資矩（ひの すけのり、宝暦6年8月22日 (旧暦)（1756年9月16日） - 文政13年7月9日 (旧暦)（1830年8月26日））は江戸時代の公卿。
sen.e: Sukenori HINO (September 16, 1756 to August 26, 1830) is a Kugyo (high court noble) in Edo period.

sen.e: His legal wife was the daughter of Mitsutsuna YANAGIHARA and his second wife was Mototsura MIBU.

sen.j: 子供に日野永光、日野資雄、日野資愛、大宮良季、娘（広幡経豊室）、娘（鍋島直与室）、娘（勘解由小路資善室）、養女（毛利匡邦室）がいる。
sen.e: Among his children were his sons Nagamitsu HINO, Sukeo HINO, Sukenaru HINO, Yoshisue OMIYA, his daughters Tsuneto HIROHATA, Naotomo NABESHIMA, Sukeyoshi KADENOKOJI, and his adopted daughter Masakuni MORI.

sen.e: Like his father, he excelled in Japanese poetry, and compiled the peom book "Senko Gyoei".
